item.title: First Vector Tag
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Your stocks was great, to bad I can’t say the same about your picture or your progress in making images.

  1. Missing colours. (Don’t care if you meant it to be black and white, it does not make it better)
  2. Your shapes are ugly placed.
  3. Your background was just weird.
  4. Stop exploiting the word vector, it does not making your picture any better.
    This is not meant as flaming, just CC.

From a scale from 1-6, I give 1.

No I have not made anything like this by my self, only easy 3D pictures for wallpaper contests on an other site, but that does not mean that I can’t say anything about yours.

Can you give me a link to where people like your work?

Read full topic

item.title: First Vector Tag
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

I must agree with zoomuh on this one. Vector brushes are not what a Vector signature makes.

As for Full Metalst, you’re the one who needs to grow up. Cowie` initial post was blunt, and could be taken as offensive, but it shouldn’t be. He was right, there’s nothing in the piece that I find attractive at all. There’s no flow from the render to the stock, and the random brushing does nothing to unify the two.

I don’t understand the message the piece is trying to convey, if there is any. Randomly placed natural shapes serve no purpose in my eyes. The quality of the work is not up to par with that of any tag you see today.

The obnoxious text detracts from the piece and is really an eyesore on an already overburdened work. You’re trying to merge multiple styles, but it was unsuccessful.

1.4/10

Read full topic

item.title: First Vector Tag
item.dc:creator: @zoomuh zoomuh
item.description:
@zoomuh wrote:

[quote=“Cowie`, post:29, topic:281849”][quote author=Full Metalst link=topic=372454.msg2810633#msg2810633 date=1243972796]
I’m taking the CC, I can’t question it? And it’s monotone for a reason. It’s BLACK AND WHITE. Which means that it has to be monotone, it has great depth and flow, and there may be just two stocks but there are more layers and work than you think.
[/quote]

Vector sigs are usually in some ways abstract, they have usage of bright and striking colours and brushing. Monotone doesn’t suit a vector sig and the sig doesn’t have to be monotone either.

It has no depth at all, and the flow sucks because of the great cut through the middle of your focal point.

It’s not about the quantity of resources used, it’s about the quality. You might have put work into it but you overkilled it and made the signature look bad.[/quote]
You obviously have no idea what a vector tag consists, in fact, none of you do looking at Full Metalst’s tag and the critique here. A vector is an image that can be fully scaled down to any size and not lose quality. Just by using vector brushes and not even using pen tool or Illustrator does NOT make it a vector.

And to counter what you said Cowie, vector tags CAN INDEED be monotoned and don’t need to have dazzling colors. Here, I’ll prove you wrong:



(Not made by me, but friends from a graphics forum)

Read full topic

item.title: First Vector Tag
item.dc:creator: @eVokki1 Cowie`
item.description:
@eVokki1 wrote:

Full Metalst:

I’m taking the CC, I can’t question it? And it’s monotone for a reason. It’s BLACK AND WHITE. Which means that it has to be monotone, it has great depth and flow, and there may be just two stocks but there are more layers and work than you think.

Vector sigs are usually in some ways abstract, they have usage of bright and striking colours and brushing. Monotone doesn’t suit a vector sig and the sig doesn’t have to be monotone either.

It has no depth at all, and the flow sucks because of the great cut through the middle of your focal point.

It’s not about the quantity of resources used, it’s about the quality. You might have put work into it but you overkilled it and made the signature look bad.

item.title: First Vector Tag
item.dc:creator: @eVokki1 Cowie`
item.description:
@eVokki1 wrote:

[quote=“Full Metalst, post:19, topic:281849”]Well, why don’t you make a sig THEN compliment on my work you stupid piece of shit? I open it up on a daily basis to get better and apparently I’m better than what you will ever make, so shut the fuck up. Apparently you’re a dumbfuck trying to act cool on a site filled with losers that just want to make your life a living hell. Go back to your little box homeless bastard, and eating out of the garbage isn’t a good thing. Get a job fucktard.

Get a life. Don’t site on a machine all day trying to make up comebacks to a person you don’t know, and stop trying to act cool on a site that doesn’t appreciate you or anyone else. Stop being so inconsiderate, stfu, and get off my topic. If you don’t do graphics, then get the fuck off and stop wasting my time.[/quote]

I heard you are a complete idiot. Your work is shit and just because I don’t do graphic design it doesn’t mean I cannot tell a piece of shit from a piece of shit.

I also find it funny how you call me a dumbfuck when you’re screaming because someone said your little picture looked like dogshit, also I don’t think I’m trying to act cool on a site full of loosers, I infact think I’m saying that your shitty little design looks like it was made by a three year old downy in paint.

I also hardly think the 10 minutes I’ve spent writing back to your shitty little “LOL UR HOMELESS BITCH ASS DUMB NOOB FU” comments isn’t a whole day of comebacks.

Next please.
